gw.pl.util

Class ArgCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.util.ArgCheck

  • public class ArgCheck
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a simple refactoring of a chunks of common code called all the time to ensure a parameter to a method meets some precondition.

    A reminder to be cautious with the range checks on floating point values.

      • nonBlank

        public static void nonBlank(java.lang.String arg,
            java.lang.String argName)
        Checks to see if a String is not null and has a length greater than 0. Equivalent to longerThan(String, 0)
        Parameters:
        arg - The argument to check
        argName - The name of the argument to be check. Used as part of the message for the IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the test fails

      • nonWhitespace

        public static void nonWhitespace(java.lang.String arg,
                 java.lang.String argName)
        Checks to see if a trimmed String a length greater than 0. Equivalent to longerThan(String.trim(), 0)
        Parameters:
        arg - The argument to check
        argName - The name of the argument to be check. Used as part of the message for the IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the test fails

      • isAssignable

        public static void isAssignable(java.lang.Class argClass,
                java.lang.Class baseClass,
                java.lang.String argName)
        Checks to make sure that a class is assignable from another class. Essentially, this means making sure that the argument class is a subclass of the given baseClass, or implements the base class if the base class is an interface
        Parameters:
        argClass - The argument to check
        baseClass - The class that argument must be a subclass (or implementer) of
        argName - The name of the argument to be check. Used as part of the message for the IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the test fails
